page.title: 02Cambridge Fen,Newnham
page.content: Cambridge has much marshy fen by the river -Coe Fen (formerly Cow Fen), Lammas land and Sheep's Green -which have been used for hundreds of years as common grazing land by the people of Cambridge. Although part of it has been drained and cultivated for a public park,horses and cows are still grazed on the remainder thus preserving the natural balance of vegetation. This grazing is regulated by an official who bears the ancient title of City Pinder. The River Cam (or Granta) meanders northwards through the Fen. In summer there is rowing and punting on the river and picnicking in the meadows. Coe Fen has an interesting nature trail. You can see oak,alder,lime and willow trees-water figwort,buttercups, ragwort,willowherb and water forget- me-nots.
